DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Details Clinical Indication java.lang.Integer
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.:A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease.:Particulars considered individually and in relation to a whole._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication)._Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is an Integer (32-bit two's complement).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.:A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease.:Particulars considered individually and in relation to a whole._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.:A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease.:Particulars considered individually and in relation to a whole.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
Particulars considered individually and in relation to a whole.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/1/11 Released as part of Lymphoma Enterprise Architecture Data System (LEADS) model cleanup.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is an Integer (32-bit two's complement).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
